content.description: Step up and over a small overlap and diagonal right, staying on the steeper rock, to join Paw Patrol at it's last bolt.
content.location:
Far left side of the face and just left of

Paw Patrol

.

climbs.name: Paw Patrol
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Greg Sidberry and Christina Fonseca, March 2021

content.description: Climb a ramp to a seam in a shallow corner, pull a bulge and finish up past large intrusions to the end of the difficulties where a long, easy stretch reaches the anchors.
content.protection:
3 bolts, bolted anchor

Last bolt shared with

Jesus of Suburbia

.
content.location:
Left side of the face and just left of

Jesus of Suburbia

.

climbs.name: Jesus of Suburbia
climbs.fa: Greg Sidberry and Chris Miller, March 2021

content.description: Easy moves up to a smooth bulge with just enough holds and then fun climbing up large intrusions to the end of the difficulties where a long, easy stretch reaches the anchors.
content.protection:
3 bolts, bolted anchor

Last bolt shared with

Paw Patrol

.
content.location:
Left side of the face and just left of

Jesus Crack

.

content.description: Thin hands, good features to both side of crack.
content.location: Left of center on the wall.

climbs.name: Hey Zeus!
climbs.fa: Greg Sidberry and Chris Miller, February 2021

content.description:
A slippery start passing through a water streak is the crux and above delicate climbing past large intrusions culminates in a surprisingly fun and easy roof.

Climbing left of the first bolt is 5.10c and climbing right of the first bolt is 5.10a.
content.protection:
4 bolts, anchors

Last 2 bolts shared with

Cold Noses, Warm Hearts

.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the face just right of

Jesus Crack

.

climbs.name: Cold Noses, Warm Hearts
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Greg Sidberry, February 2021

content.description: Fire off a boulder problem down low to gain a slanting ramp and then wander up the face past large intrusions to a final, fun pull over a roof.
content.protection:
4 bolts, anchors

Last 2 bolts shared with

Hey Zeus!

.
content.location:
Located just right of

Hey Zeus!

and shares the start with

All Dogs Go to Heaven

.

climbs.name: All Dogs Go to Heaven
climbs.fa: Greg Sidberry and Chris Miller, Feb 2021

content.description: Shares crux start with route to the left. Starting behind the tree/bush, pull overhung start and move to small ledge/lip then vertical crack. Hands and feet to finger exit at right side of overhang.
content.protection: Mostly cams to 3+ inches, bolted anchor
content.location:
Right crack on face with

Jesus Crack

.
